この本は詳細に過ぎる
The book has the fault of over-minuteness.

content:
しょうさん〔賞讃〕
〈名〉Praise; compliment; commendation; applause; laudation; admiration; approbation; approval:(=する) to praise (one's diligence―one for one's diligence); to compliment (one on one's success); to commend (one's spirit); to applaud (one's speech); to laud (one's work); to admire (one's learning); to extol (one's work); to approve of (one's conduct); to speak well of, speak highly of, speak in high terms of (one)

content.content: 大将は部下の勇敢を賞讃した
The general praised the bravery of his men―praised his men for their bravery.
賞讃を得る
to meet one's approbation―meet one's approval
僕の計画は有力家の賞讃を得た
My project met the approbation of influential people.
賞讃を博す
to win applause―win admiration
彼は腕を揮るって世間の賞讃を博した
He won universal admiration by his performance.
彼の処置は賞讃の価値がある
His conduct deserves praise―His conduct is worthy of praise.
賞讃の価値ある行為だ
It is a praiseworthy action―a commendable action.
彼の行動は賞讃するに言葉無し、賞讃するに余りあり
I can not speak too highly of his conduct―His conduct is above praise.
口を極めて賞讃する
to extol one to the skies―laud one's work to the skies―sing one's praises
世間でも口を極めて彼を賞讃している
People are loud in his praises―warm in his praises.
賞讃を呈す
to pay a tribute of praise
彼の近作には賞讃を呈せざるを得ぬ
I must pay my tribute of praise to his latest work.

content:

The chances are in my favour―The odds are in my favour.
勝算が無い
The chances are against me―The odds are against me.
全然勝算が無い
The chances are dead against me.
彼に対しては勝算がある
I stand a chance against him.
彼に対して充分勝算がある
I stand a good chance against him.
彼に対しては勝算が無い
I stand no chance against him.
七分三分の勝算がある
The odds are 7 to 3 in my favour.
四分六の勝算だ
The odds are 4 to 6 against me.

content:
しょうじき〔正直〕
〈名〉(不正なことをせぬ正直)honesty:(偽りを言わぬ正直)truthfulness; veracity:(=な) honest; truthful; veracious

content.content: あれは正直者だ
He is an honest fellow.
ばか正直だ
He is too honest―as simple as a child.
性根が正直だ
He is made of true metal.
正直に損無し
“Honesty is the best policy.”
彼が正直なことは顔を見ればわかる
You can see by his face that he is honest.
正直にさえすれば誰でも主人の気に入る
Honesty will recommend any one to his employer.
彼は正直一遍の人だ
He has nothing but his honesty to recommend him.
子どもは正直だ
“Children and fools speak the truth.”
正直に言えば
To be honest with you―To tell the truth,...
正直のところ君の計画はあまり感心しない
To tell the truth, I don't care much for your project.
人は正直に付き合え
Deal honestly with all men!
お互いに正直に付き合おうじゃないか
Let us be honest with each other!
正直の頭に神宿る
God dwells in an honest heart.

content:

〈名〉Common sense; mother-wit; practical wisdom

content.content: 常識をもって判断する

これは常識でわかることだ
It is to be judged by common sense.
あれは常識のある人だ
He is a man of sense―a sensible man.
彼は常識に富んでいる、常識が発達している
He is rich in common sense―He has good sense―sound sense―strong sense.
彼は教育が無いが常識は非常に発達している
He is uneducated, but a man of sterling sense.
あの人は常識を欠いている
He is wanting in common sense.
常識を欠くも程がある
What, in the name of common sense, have you done?
一片の常識があるならそんなことをするはずがない
If he has a particle of common sense,―a grain of common sense,―he will not act so foolishly.
彼の為すことは常識にはずれている
He is cranky―He is a crank.

〈名〉Destruction by fire:(=する) to be destroyed by fire; to be burnt down; to be reduced to ashes

content:
じょうじつ〔情実〕
〈名〉
1. (=私情)private circumstances; private considerations; personal considerations; sentimental motives; sentimentality; sentiment; favouritism

content.content: 情実が行なわれる
Personal considerations have sway.
政府の任用には少しも情実が行なわれない
Government appointments are never influenced by private considerations.
彼は情実に迷って断然たる処置ができない

情実があって老朽の淘汰が行なわれない

彼は情実によって昇進したのだ

情実の弊は公私を弁ぜざるより生ず

僕は毫も情実を許さぬ
I am not influenced by sentiment.

content: 2. (=真情)the real state of things; the true facts of the case

content:
じょうじゅ〔成就〕
〈名〉Completion (of works); attainment (of an object); accomplishment (of a purpose); achievement (of a deed); fulfilment (of a desire); realization (of one's wishes); success (of an enterprise):(=する) to complete (the works); to attain (one's object); to accomplish (one's purpose); to achieve (a deed); to realize (one's wishes); to succeed (in an enterprise); (one's desire) is fulfilled

content:
しょうしょ〔証書〕
〈名〉
1. (=証文)a bond; a deed; a document; an instrument; a paper

content.content: 証書を書く
to draw up a bond―sign a paper
証書を作成する

念のため証書を書かせた

content.content: 彼は小心な人だ

〈名〉Promotion; advancement; rise:(=する) to be promoted; to be advanced; to rise; to get one's step:(=させる) to promote; to advance; to raise; to give (one) a step

content.content: 此度は御昇進の由新聞上にて拝承仕候
I read in the paper that you have been promoted.
追って昇進のご沙汰があるだろう
You will be promoted in due course.

陸軍は昇進が遅い

古参昇進

A man may be as talented as he will, and yet, if he is not good, he may be a paltry fellow.

content:
じょうず〔上手〕
〈形〉Good (at a game) ; clever (at translation) ; dexterous (at accounts) ; skilful (in shooting―with the gun) ; proficient (in English) ; adept (in the art) ; expert (in or at some art) ; adroit (manager) ; tactful (management) ; at home (in the saddle) :(名詞に訳せば) tact (in teaching) ; a good hand (at all games) ; an adept (in the art) ; an expert (in or at some art) :(=に) well; skilfully; dexterously; cleverly; with tact

content.content: 彼は馬が上手だ
He rides well―He is a good rider―He is a good horseman―He is good at horsemanship―He is skilful in horsemanship―He is at home in the saddle.
水泳が上手だ
He swims well―He is a good swimmer―He is good at swimming―He floats like a cork.
文章が上手だ
He writes well―He writes a good style―He is a good writer.
字が上手だ
He writes a good hand―He is a good penman.
演説が上手だ
He speaks well in public―He is a good public-speaker―He is good at speaking in public―He is at home on the platform.
話が上手だ
(談話なら)He talks well―He is a good talker―(物語りなら)―He is a good hand at telling stories―He is a good story-teller.
笛が上手だ
He plays well on the flute―He is a skilful performer on the flute.
絵が上手だ
He paints well―He draws well―He is a good painter.
授業が上手だ
He is a good teacher―He has tact in teaching.
英語が上手だ
He is proficient in English―at home in English.
玉突きが上手だ
He plays billiards well―He is a good billiard-player―He is a good hand at billiards.
鉄砲が上手だ
He is skilful in shooting―skilful with the gun―a good shot―a good marksman.
弓が上手だ
He is a good archer―skilful with bow and arrow.
撃剱が上手だ
He fences well―He is a good fencer―He plays a good stick.
計算が上手だ
He is quick at accounts―good at figures―death on figures.
嘘が上手だ
He has a good imagination.
会話は下手だが翻訳が上手だ
He speaks poorly, but translates well―He is a poor speaker, but a good translator.
勝負事ならなんでも上手だ
He is a good hand at all games.
金儲けが上手だ
He is a good man of business.
交際が上手だ
He has social talents.
あの女はやりくりが上手だ
She cuts and contrives well―She is a good contriver.
上手になる
to become skilful―attain skill―become proficient―attain proficiency―improve
君は英語が上手になった
You have improved in your English.
君はどうして英語がそう上手になった
How did you become so proficient―attain such proficiency―improve yourself―in English?
上手にたちまわる
to play one's cards well
じょうずに取入る
to ingratiate oneself with―insinuate oneself into the good graces of―a person
あの女はばかや気違いを上手にあしらう
She manages a fool or a madman with tact―She knows how to manage a fool or a madman.
どんな難物でも上手に扱う
The hardest cases are wax in her hands.
好きこそ物の上手なれ
“What one likes, one will do well.”
上手の手から水が漏る
“A good marksman may miss” ―“Even Homer nods sometimes.”

content: 〈名〉(=お上手)flattery; cajolery; blarney; flummery; honeyed words; soft soap; soft sawder; rose-water

content.content: あの人はお上手を言う
He will flatter you―cajole you―use honeyed words.
お上手者だ
He is fair-spoken―smooth-tongued―honey-mouthed.

content.content: 少数の人はそう言う

王は少数の兵を率いて群がる敵を喰い止めた

content.content: こちらが少数だ
We are in a minority.

That is the opinion of the minority.

〈名〉The multiplier

content:
じょうすう〔常数〕
〈名〉
1. (=自然の成行、運命)the natural course of the things; the course of nature; destiny

content.content: あのような人の失敗するのは常数だ
It is in the course of nature―but natural―that such men should fail.
彼の失敗したのは常数だ
He was destined to failure―doomed to failure.

content: 2. ［物理］A constant

しょうする〔称する〕
〈他動〉
1. (=何を何と呼ぶ)to call; to style; to denominate; to describe (something as anything)

content.content: 大阪を日本の Venice と称す
Osaka is called the Venice of Japan.
人口百万と称す
Its population is called a million.
彼女は美人と称せらる
She is called a beauty―described as a beauty.
日本一と称せらる
It is called the first in Japan―known as the first in Japan.
通称儀助と称す
He goes by the name of Gisuke.
詩人と称すべき詩人は一人も無い
There is no poet worthy of the name.
家は好い家だが庭園と称すべき庭園が無い
The house is a good one, but there is no garden to speak of.
彼は優に一世の学者と称するに足る
He is well worthy of the title of the first scholar of the age―He may well claim the title of the first scholar of the age.
とにかく世間で彼を豪傑と称している
He is reputed a hero.
一 quart 入りと称する徳利
a reputed quart bottle

content: 2. (=偽る)to pretend; to profess; to purport; to feign; to call oneself

content.content: 病と称す
to pretend to be ill―feign illness
彼は病と称して面会を謝絶した
He declined to see me on the pretence of illness―under pretence of illness―on the plea of illness―under plea of illness.
彼は僕の親友と称している
He calls himself my intimate friend―He professes to be my bosom friend.
これが本人が書いたと称する手紙だ
This is a letter purporting to be written by himself.
廃兵と称していかさま物を売りつけて歩く者がある
Some men calling themselves disabled soldiers go about imposing questionable articles upon people.

content: 3. (=何と名乗る)to call oneself; to assume a name

content.content: 剃髪して浄海と称す
He took the tonsure, and called himself Jokai―assumed the name of Jokai.

content: 4. (=自ら何を以て任ずる)to call oneself; to claim a title

content.content: 彼は日本一の英学者と称している
He calls himself the first English scholar of Japan―claims the title of the first English scholar of Japan.

content:
しょうする〔証する〕
〈他動〉
1. (=証拠立てる)to prove, be proof of, be evidence of, witness, bear witness to, testify to, show (a fact); to bespeak, argue (a matter); to support, bear out, corroborate, confirm (one's statement)

content.content: この事実は彼の無罪なることを証している

The fact shows that he is innocent―proves his innocence―is proof of his innocence―is proof that he is innocent―is evidence of his innocence―witnesses his innocence―bears witness to his innocence―testifies to his innocence.
ここに彼の無罪を証する事実がある
Here are some facts proving his innocence―in proof of his innocence―in witness of his innocence.
空家の多いのが世間の不景気を証している
The numbers of vacant houses show―witness―bear witness to―testify to―the badness of the times.
これらの事実は彼の非凡なることを証するに足る
These facts suffice to show that he is no common being.
この事実は僕の言を証するに足る
This fact serves to bear out my statement―support my statement―corroborate my statement―confirm my statement.
彼の行為は心の親切なことを証している
His action shows―bespeaks―a kind heart.
僕を知らないようでは君の世に知られぬことを証している
Not to know me argues yourself unknown.

content: 2. (=証明する)to certify (that...)

content.content: 右は本校正科を修了したることを証す
This is to certify that the above has finished the regular course of the present institution.

content:
しょうする〔賞する〕
〈他動〉
1. (=賞与する)to reward (one's diligence―one for one's diligence)

content.content: 天汝の正直を賞したり
Heaven has rewarded your honesty―Heaven has rewarded you for your honesty.
功を賞す
to reward one's services
彼は功を賞して恩給を賜わった
He was granted a pension in reward for his services―in recognition of his services.

content: 2. (=賞讃する)to praise (one's bravery―one for one's bravery); to compliment (one on one's success); to commend (one's spirit); to applaud (one's speech); to laud (one's work); to admire (one's learning, etc.)

content.content: 大将は部下の勇敢を賞した
The general praised the bravery of his men―The general praised his men for their bravery.
その処置賞すべし
His conduct is worthy of praise―praiseworthy―to be commended―commendable―laudable.
その処置賞するに余りあり
His conduct is above praise.
花を賞す
to praise the blossoms―admire the blossoms―enjoy the view of blossoms
花を賞して歌を詠ず
Poems are written in praise of the blossoms.
月下花を賞す
to view the cherry-blossoms bathed in moonlight

content: 3. (=賞美する)to prize (anything for some quality)

content:
しょうずる〔生ずる〕
〈他動〉(=何を生ずる)to produce (a result); to cause (good or evil); to bring about (a result); to breed (worms); to generate (heat or electricity); to engender (a feeling); to yield (profit); to raise (a disturbance); to give birth to (sects); to give rise to (a rumour); to give occasion to (troubles, etc.)

content.content: 結果を生ずる
to produce a result―bring about a result
大戦が好結果を生じた
The Great War has produced good results―been productive of good results.
どうしてこんな結果を生じたか
How was this result brought about?
圧制が革命を生じた
The tyranny caused a revolution.
傷が腐敗して蛆を生ずる
The wound festers and breeds worms.
利益を生ずる
to yield (one) profit―give one profit―bring one profit
この投資はだいぶ利益を生ずる
The investment yields a large profit―returns a large profit.
摩擦すると熱と電気を生ずる
Friction generates heat and electricity.
ぜいたくを覚えると金の慾を生ずる
Luxury engenders a desire for wealth.
その事件が騒ぎを生じた
The affair raised a disturbance―created a disturbance.
この問題が多くの宗派を生じた
The question gave birth to many sects.
事が悶着を生じた
The matter gave rise to troubles.
この問題が政界の葛藤を生じた
The matter gave occasion to complications in the political world.
その時彼が欠席したために死んだという噂を生じた
His absence on the occasion gave rise to the rumour that he was dead.
必要を生ずる
to cause necessity―necessitate
弊害が蓄積すると革命の必要を生ずる
Accumulated abuses necessitate a revolution.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 変化を生ずる
to work a change
新生活が彼の性格に一大変化を生じた
His new life worked a great change in his character.
船が漏口を生じた
The ship sprang a leak.
故障を生ずる
Something went wrong.
機関に故障を生じた
Something went wrong with the engine―The engine broke down―There was engine-trouble.
殺意を生ずる
to conceive a murderous design
彼はふと悪心を生じた
He obeyed an evil impulse―yielded to temptation―listened to the voice of the tempter.
疑心暗鬼を生ず
“Fear peoples the darkness with monsters.”
見ると肌に粟を生ずる
The sight makes my flesh creep.

content:
〈自動〉
1. (=何が生ずる)to grow; to breed; to arise; to occur; to come about; to spring up; to be generated

content.content: この植物は我が国では天然に生ずる
This plant grows wild in Japan.
腐肉に蛆が生ずる
Maggots breed in carrion―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Carrion breeds maggots.
どうしてこんな結果が生じたか
How did this result come about?
ここに一つの困難が生ずる
Here arises a difficulty.
かくして革命の必要が生ずる
Thus arises the necessity of a revolution.
摩擦すると熱と電気が生ずる
Heat and electricity are generated by friction―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Friction generates heat and electricity.
欠損が生ずる
A vacancy occurs.
新思想が生ずる
New ideas spring up.

content: 2. (=何より生ずる)to grow (out of the earth); to arise (from or out of some cause); to result (from some cause); to spring (from some origin); to flow (from some source); to ensue (from some event); to accrue (from some investment); to originate (from or in some cause); to come (of some cause); to be born (of something)

content.content: 草木は地から生ずる
Plants grow out of the earth.
サンフランシスコ事件は人種的偏見より生じた
The San Francisco troubles arose from racial prejudice.
滅亡は驕慢より生ず(驕る者は亡ぶ)
Ruin results from pride―“Pride goes before a fall.”
富は勉強より生ずる(辛抱する木にゃ金が生る)

この習慣は妙な出来事から生じた
The custom sprang from a curious incident.
この戦争は勢力争いから生じた
The war originated from rivalry―resulted from rivalry.
この商売からだいぶ利益が生ずる
A large profit accrues from this business.
大戦から種々の社会運動が生じた

自信は知識より生ずる
Confidence is born of knowledge.
無から有は生ぜぬ

凶事から吉事が生ずる(雨降って地固まる)
“Good comes out of evil.”

content:
じょうずる〔乗ずる〕
〈他動〉
1. (=付け込む)to take advantage of (some weakness) ; to avail oneself of (some circumstance) ; to profit by, benefit by (some circumstance) ; to take (a person in some state)

content.content: 相手の弱点に乗ずる

He availed himself of public troubles to attain the object of his ambition.
混雑に乗じて逃げた
He profited by the confusion―benefited by the confusion―and escaped.
虚に乗ずる、油断に乗ずる
to take one off one's guard―take one unawares―catch one napping
彼は乗ずべき隙が無い
He is never off his guard―ever on his guard.
敵の不備に乗ずる
to take advantage of the unprepared state of the enemy―take the enemy at a disadvantage―take the enemy at vantage
敵に乗ぜられるようなことをするな
Do not give your enemy a handle against you―give your enemy a handle for your censure.
機会に乗ずる
to seize the opportunity―seize the occasion―seize the moment―seize upon a chance―snatch at a chance
待ちかまえていて機会に乗ぜよ
Take time by the forelock!
勢に乗ずる
to swim with the stream―swim with the tide―swim with the current

to follow up an advantage
勝ちに乗じてむやみに進んだ
Elated with success, they advanced recklessly.
興に乗じてうまいことを言う
He will say witty things in a moment of mirth.
酒興に乗じてしゃべり出した

酒興に乗じて女どもを追いまわした
He chased the girls in a drunken frolic.
怒りに乗じてうっかりしたことを言ってしまった
I spoke unguardedly in a fit of passion―in the heat of passion.
夜陰に乗じて攻撃を行う
An assault was delivered under cover of night―under favour of darkness.

content:
しょうたい〔招待〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: しょうだい〔招待〕

content:
しょうたい〔正体〕
〈名〉
1. (=本当の姿、真の性格)one's natural shape; one's true character; one's true colours

content.content: 正体を顕わす
A fox reveals its natural shape―A man reveals his true character―shows his true colours―shows himself in his true colours―throws off the mask.
もう猫をかぶっても駄目だ、正体を顕わせ
It is no use playing the hypocrite any longer―show yourself in your true colours.
あれがあの男の正体だ
That is the true character of the man―He has revealed his true character.
化物の正体を見露す
to unmask a ghost―expose an apparition
あの男の正体を見露してやる
I will unmask him―expose him―find him out―prove his identity.
化物の正体見たり枯尾花
The ghost proved to be a beckoning flower.

content: 2. (=正気)consciousness

content.content: 彼は正体無く酔っている
He is dead drunk―drunk and incapable.
酔うと正体無くなる
He drinks himself dead drunk.
正体無く寝ている
He is dead asleep―fast asleep―sound asleep.

content:
しょうだい〔招待〕
〈名〉Invitation:(=する) to invite (one to a party); to ask (one to dinner); to bid (one to a wedding)

content.content: 招待に応ずる
to accept an invitation
招待を断わる
to decline an invitation
ご招待に与ってありがとう存じます
I thank you for your kind invitation.
せっかくのご招待ですが先約があるため残念ながらお断わり致します
Previous engagement obliges me to decline your kind invitation.
会長の招待によって出席した
I attended the meeting at the invitation of―by the invitation of―on the invitation of―the president.
貴賓を招待して宴を張った
A banquet was held in honour of the illustrious guest.
招待状
a letter of invitation―an invitation-card
招待状を送る
to send one an invitation
招待状を一千通も出した
No less than 1,000 invitations were issued.
それでも招待に漏れた者がある
But some people were left out of the invitation.
招待券
a complimentary ticket

content:
しょうだい〔掌大〕
〈形〉As large as a palm; no bigger than a palm

content.content: 掌大の地
a bit of ground―a strip of land

content:
しょうだい〔昭代〕
〈名〉A glorious reign; a brilliant era; an enlightened age

content.content: これも昭代の余沢だ
This is one of the blessings of a glorious reign.
昭和の昭代に遭遇した君達は幸福な人達だ
Bless your stars that you have fallen upon the glorious era of Showa!
昭和の昭代にそんなことがあってたまるものか
How can such things be in this enlightened age?
正に昭和の昭代を飾るべき大著述である
It is a work well calculated to grace the Showa era.

content:
じょうたい〔常態〕
〈名〉The normal state; the normal condition

content.content: 事物常態に復す
Things are restored to their normal state.

content:
じょうたい〔状態〕
〈名〉State; condition; plight; predicament; state of things; state of matters; state of affairs

content.content: 物質の三状態(固体、液体、気体)
three states of matter
病人は危険状態にある
The invalid is in a critical state―in a critical condition.
彼らは憐むべき状態にある
They are in a pitiable predicament―in a sorry plight―in a bad way.
目下の状態ではいかんともすべからず
In the present state of things,―In the existing state of affairs,―As matters now stand,―nothing can be done.
兵員は健康状態好し、健康状態悪し
The men are in condition―out of condition.
精神状態
state of mind
生活状態
the conditions of life

じょうだい〔上代〕
〈名〉Ancient times; old times; antiquity

content:
じょうだい〔城代〕
〈名〉A castellan

content.content: 城代家老
the retainer in charge of his lord's castle

しょうだいけん〔招待券〕
〈名〉A complimentary ticket

content:
しょうたく〔妾宅〕
〈名〉A kept mistress's house; a separate establishment

content.content: 妾宅を構える
to keep a separate establishment

しょうたく〔沼沢〕
〈名〉A marsh; a swamp; a bog; a fen

content:
しょうだく〔承諾〕
〈名〉Consent; assent; agreement; compliance; acquiescence; acceptance; sanction:(=する) to consent (to a plan―to do something); to give one's consent; to assent to (a proposal); to agree (to a proposal―to do something); to comply with (a request); to acquiesce in (an arrangement); to accept (the terms)

content.content: 君は無論承諾のことと思った
I took it for granted that you would consent.
先方は承諾したか
Has he consented?―given his consent?
彼は仕事の引受け方を承諾したか
Has he consented to undertake the work?―agreed to undertake the work?
彼は僕の相談を快く承諾してくれた
He readily consented to my proposal.
僕の依頼を快く承諾しくれた
He readily complied with my request.
このことばかりは承諾しかねます
I would consent to anything but that.
彼はこのことばかりは承諾すまい
This is the last thing he would consent to.
人の承諾を求める
to ask one's consent
承諾を得る、承諾を経る
to obtain one's consent
彼の承諾を経てしたことだ
It was done with his consent.
僕の承諾を経ずにしたのが不都合だ
I must blame you for doing it without my consent.
ご承諾があれば明日にも実行します
If you consent,―Subject to your consent,―I shall carry it out tomorrow.
頼まれていやいやながら承諾した
I was obliged to comply with his request against my will.
説得してようやく承諾さした
I reasoned him into compliance.
無理に承諾さした
I forced him into acquiescence.
そのような条件では承諾しかねます
I can not consent to such terms―accept such terms.
その条件でなら承諾しよう
I would consent on that condition―accept on that condition.
沈黙は承諾のうち
“Silence gives consent.”
うなずいて承諾の意を表す
to nod assent
彼はお辞儀をして承諾の意を表した
He bowed assent.
事後承諾を得る
to obtain one's ex post facto sanction

content:
じょうたつ〔上達〕
〈名〉Progress; improvement; advancement:(=する) to progress (in one's studies) ; to improve (in one's English) ; to advance (in knowledge)

content.content: 彼は学問が上達した
He has progressed in his studies―advanced in knowledge.
学問の上達が早い
He makes rapid progress in his studies.
学問の上達
advancement in knowledge
君は英語が上達した
You have improved in your English.
英語の上達を図る
to improve oneself in English
僕は英語に上達したい
I wish to improve myself in English―better my English.

content:
しょうたん〔小胆〕
〈名〉A faint heart; timidity; cowardice; pusillanimity:(=な) faint-hearted; chicken-hearted; timid; cowardly; pusillanimous

content.content: 彼は小胆者だ
He is a timid man―a coward―He can't say Bo! to a goose.

content:
しょうたん〔賞歎〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: たんしょう〔嘆賞〕

content:
じょうだん〔上段〕
〈名〉
1. (=高座)a dais

content.content: 上段の間
a room with a raised floor

content: 2. ［剣術］High guard (the highest position of the sword)

content.content: 上段にかまえる
to assume the high guard―hold one's sword over one's head

content:
じょうだん〔冗談〕
〈名〉A joke; a jest; fun; pleasantry; witticism:(=に) jestingly; in jest; in joke; in sport; in play; in fun; for fun; out of fun

content.content: 冗談にやってみたのさ
I tried it in joke―in fun―for fun.
彼は冗談にそう言ったに違いない
He must have said so in joke―in jest―in fun.
冗談にも死ぬなどと言うものでない
You should not talk of dying even in joke.
冗談半分に聞いてみた
I asked him half in joke―half in jest.
僕が冗談に言ったことを人は真に受けた
What I said in joke, was taken seriously.
冗談を言う
to jest―joke―crack a joke―break a jest―be funny―be merry―be witty―be pleasant
彼は平生は真面目だが酔うと冗談を言う
He is grave at other times, but merry over his cups.
冗談ばかり言っている
He is always joking.
僕が冗談を言ったら一座がどっと笑った
The company roared with laughter over my joke―(他動詞構文にすれば)―My joke set the table in a roar.
君は冗談を言われて腹を立てないか
Can you take a joke in good part?
冗談を言う場合でない
You must not be pleasant about it.
冗談言っちゃいかん
No joking!
冗談言うな
None of your jokes!
冗談止せ
No more of your jokes!―Enough of your jokes!―Have done with joking!
冗談にもほどがある、冗談もたいがいにしろ
You carry your joke too far―That's carrying a joke too far―There are limits to a man's patience―I'll stand no nonsense.
そりゃ冗談だろう
You are joking―You don't say so!
冗談じゃない
I mean what I say―I am not joking.
冗談は冗談として(冗談はさておいて)本当にどうするつもりか
Joking apart, what do you really intend to do?
冗談は止して真面目なところどうするつもりか
Honestly and frankly,―Really and truly,―Indeed and indeed,―To be serious,―what do you mean to do?
冗談あしらいにする
to treat a matter as a joke
冗談まじりに話した
He told the story in a jocular vein.
冗談事じゃない
It is no joke―no joking matter.
オイ冗談じゃないぜ、何をする
Confound you! What do you mean by that?
冗談の果てがけんか
The joke ended in a quarrel.
始めは冗談、果てはけんか
The matter began in a joke, and ended in a quarrel.

しょうち〔勝地〕
〈名〉A place of scenic beauty; a beauty spot

しょうち〔小智〕
〈名〉Shallow wisdom; superficial knowledge

content:
しょうち〔承知〕
〈名〉
1. (=承諾)an agreement; consent; assent; compliance; acquiescence; acceptance:(=する) to agree (to a proposal―to do anything); to consent (to a plan―to do something); to assent to (a plan); to have no objection to (a plan); to comply with (a request); to accede to (a request); to acquiesce in (an arrangement); to accept (the terms, etc.)

content.content: 彼は快く承知してくれた
(相談ごとになら)He readily consented to my proposal―(依頼になら)―He readily complied with my request.
二つ返事で承知する
to give a ready consent
僕は洋行したいが母が承知しない
I wish to go abroad, but my mother will not consent to the plan―my mother objects to the plan.
母がどうしても承知しない
My mother will not hear of it.
そんな相談には承知ができん
I can't agree to such a proposal.
そんなことは承知せん
I can't agree to it―I will not hear of it.
彼はぐずぐず言ってなかなか承知しない
He demurs to the plan―make objections to the plan―raises objections―makes difficulties.
そのことばかりは承知しかねる
I would consent to anything but that.
彼はこのことばかりは承知すまい
This is the last thing he would consent to.
母が取り持っても娘が承知しない
The mother pleaded with her daughter, who, however, would not consent.
僕はむずかしい人間じゃない、たいがいのことなら承知する
I am not hard to please, I would consent to anything in reason.
しかしこの条件では承知しかねる
But I can not consent to such terms―accept the terms.
老いの一徹なかなか承知しない
He persists in refusing with an old man's obstinacy.
ご承知ならそう致しましょう
I will do so if you agree to it―if you don't mind it―if you have no objection.
(用を命ぜられて)承知しました
I will see to it―All right!
委細承知仕りました
Very well, sir―You shall be obeyed in every particular.
旦那様も奥様も内々ご承知です
Master and mistress tacitly consent to our union.
(二人は)互いに承知の上で別れた
They separated by common consent.
黙っていると承知したものと看倣します
“Silence gives consent,” you know.
好きな専門を選ぶと腹の虫が承知する
Every fibre of your being consents to the profession of your choice.
好きな専門を選ばないと腹の虫が承知しない
Every fibre of your being protests against a profession which is not congenial to your tastes.
彼に結婚を勧めて承知さした
I have persuaded him to marry.
彼にいくら結婚を勧めても承知しない
I can not prevail upon him to marry―He is not to be prevailed upon.
彼女に説得してやっと承知さした
I have reasoned her into compliance.
おどしたりすかしたりしてようやく承知さした
What by threats, what by entreaties, I finally made her comply.
おどしてもすかしても承知しなかった
Neither threats nor entreaties could make her comply.
無理に承知さした
I forced her to acquiesce in the arrangement―I forced her into acquiescence.
彼に少々握らしたら承知するだろう
He will do it for a consideration.
娘はキズ物ですがご承知ならさし上げます
She is a ruined girl. You shall have her if you have no objection to that.
それは承知です
I have no objection to that.

content: 2. (=しておる)(=知っている)to know; to be aware of (the fact); to be conscious of (one's powers)

content.content: 事業の困難なことは承知しております
I know that the work is difficult―I am aware of the difficulty of the undertaking.
自分の学力の足らないことは承知しております
I am conscious of my want of ability.
(その娘はキズ物だと)それは承知です
I am aware of the fact.
(彼はキズ物と)承知の上でその娘を貰った
He married the girl with open eyes.
彼はなにもかも承知している
He is a knowing fellow―wide-awake.
なにもかも承知の上で放蕩している
He is running wild with his eyes open.
ご承知の通り手前共は新店ですから
Ours is a new house, as you are aware.
ご承知の通り病人ですからねー
He is an invalid, you know.
彼は独りで承知している
He fancies he knows everything.
そんなことは百も承知だ(百も承知二百も合点、先刻ご承知だ)
I am very well aware of the fact.
そのわけを承知したいものだ
I should like to know the reason.
あらかじめご承知を乞う
I give you due warning―give you fair warning.
そのように承知しております
So I hear―So I understand.
御書面の趣き承知仕り候
I have noted the contents of your letter.
御送付の品正に領収仕候間左様御承知被下度候
Please note that I have duly received the article you have sent me.
御尊父様御死去の由新聞紙にて承知仕り候
I read in the papers that your father is dead.

content: 3. (=せぬ)(=満足せぬ)not to be satisfied

content.content: そんな答弁では承知ができない
I am not satisfied with such an answer.
腹の虫が承知しない(まだ食い足らぬ)
My inner man is not satisfied.
謝罪しなけりゃ承知せんぞ
Nothing short of an apology will satisfy me―I insist upon your apologizing―You must apologize.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: ぜひそのわけを聞かなけりゃ承知しない
I must positively know your reason―I insist upon knowing your reason.
父は食物にはかまわないが酒は好くないと承知しない
My father does not care about what he eats, but he will have good wine.
彼は勘定を几帳面にしないと承知しない
He will have the accounts exact to the cent―He insists upon the exactness of the accounts.
少しでも間違いがあると承知しない
He will have no mistakes―He insists upon correcting the slightest mistakes.
僕はかまわないが端{はた}が承知しない
I don't care for myself, but the others will have it so―insist upon it.
彼は酒精は滋養になると言って承知しない
He will have it―He maintains―that alcohol is a food.
そんなことをすると承知せんぞ
You shall smart for it.
そんなことを言うと承知せんぞ
You shall smart for those words.
この人の身に指一本でも指すと俺が承知せんぞ
If you touch a hair of this man, you will have to reckon with me.
ふざけた真似を仕あがると俺が承知せんぞ
None of your tomfooleries, or you will have to reckon with me―have an account to settle with me.
要求に応ずればよしさもないと承知しないぞ
You must comply with my demands, or I will know the reason why.
忘れると承知しないぞ
You must not forget.
約束通りにしないと承知しないぞ
I will hold you to your promise.

content:
しょうち〔招致〕
〈名〉Invitation:(=する) to invite

content.content: 身の破滅を招致する
to draw ruin on oneself―bring down ruin on one's head

content:
じょうちいいん〔常置委員〕
〈名〉A standing committee

content.content: 僕も常置委員だ
I am a member of the standing committee―on the standing committee.

content:
しょうちゅう〔掌中〕
〈名〉In one's hands; in one's power; at one's mercy; within one's grasp

content.content: 彼は我が掌中に在り
He is in my power―at my mercy.
掌中の玉
the prize within one's grasp
掌中の玉をみすみす取り逃がした
I lost, with my eyes open, the prize within my grasp.
掌中の玉を失ったよう
I have lost the prize within my grasp.
掌中の玉と愛す
to love a child as the apple of one's eye
掌中の一羽は叢中の二羽に勝る
“A bird in the hand is worth two in the bush.”
掌中に陥る、掌中に帰す
to fall into one's hands―fall into one's possession―fall into one's power
二百三高地が我が掌中に帰した時は旅順の運命は旦夕に迫った
When the 203-Metre Heights fell into our hands, the days of Port Arthur were numbered.
この証文を書いて彼の掌中に陥ったのだ
By signing this bond, I placed myself in his power.
部下黜陟{ちゅっちょく}の権は彼の掌中にあり
He holds the destinies of his subordinates in his hands.
我らの運命は彼の掌中にあり
He holds out fate in his hands.

しょうちゅう〔焼酎〕
〈名〉Japanese spirits; ardent spirits

content:
じょうちゅう〔条虫〕
〈名〉The tapeworm; the taenia

content.content: ジョウ虫駆除薬
taeniafuge

content:
じょうちょ〔情緒〕
〈名〉Emotion; feeling

content.content: 情緒纏綿{てんめん}
Mutual feeling is in a tangle.
情緒纏綿として離るる能わず
They are bound up in each other.

content:
しょうちょう〔小腸〕
〈名〉The small intestine

content.content: (豚などの食用)小腸
chitterlings

content:
しょうちょう〔消長〕
〈名〉Prosperity and decline; rise and fall; ups and downs; vicissitudes of fortune; (varying) fortunes

content.content: 物価騰貴は国運の消長に関する
The appreciation of prices affects the prosperity of the country.
日本は幾多の消長を経て今日あるを得た
Japan has attained her present greatness after passing through various vicissitudes of fortune.
時には消長はあったが国運は着々発展した
In spite of some varying fortunes, the national prosperity made a steady development.

content:
しょうちょう〔象徴〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: ひょうしょう〔表象〕

content:
じょうちょう〔冗長〕
〈形〉Diffuse (style); verbose (speech); prolix (writer, etc.)

content.content: 冗長な文章
a diffuse style―a verbose style
氏の文は冗長の嫌いあり
His style has the fault of prolixity.

じょうちょうかん〔上長官〕
〈名〉(陸軍のは)a field-officer:(海軍のは)a fleet-officer

content:
しょうちょく〔詔勅〕
〈名〉An Imperial edict ［rescript, proclamation, message, etc.］

content.content: 衆議院に優渥なる詔勅を賜った
The Emperor was pleased to send a gracious message to the House Of Representatives.
宣戦の詔勅
an Imperial proclamation of war

content:
しょうちん〔銷沈〕
〈名〉Depression

content.content: 意気銷沈
depression of spirits
彼は意気銷沈している
He is depressed in spirits―in low spirits―in the dumps―in the blues―He has a fit of the blues.

content:
しょうつき〔祥月〕
〈名〉The month of one's death

content.content: 今日は父の祥月命日だ
Today is the anniversary of my father's death.

content:
じょうづめ〔定詰め〕
〈名〉Permanent residence:(=の) resident

content.content: 病院に定詰めの医師
a resident physician―a house-physician

しょうてい〔哨艇〕
〈名〉A vedette-boat

しょうてい〔小艇〕
〈名〉A small (ship's) boat

content:
しょうてい〔章程〕
〈名〉Regulations

content.content: 職務章程
office regulations―office routine

じょうてい〔上帝〕
〈名〉God; the Supreme Being; the Almighty; the Absolute

じょうていおんぶ〔上低音部〕
〈名〉Barytone

content:
しょうてき〔小敵〕
〈名〉A small enemy

content.content: 小敵と見て侮るな
Despise not a small enemy.

content:
じょうでき〔上出来〕
〈名〉A good performance; a success:(=の) successful (attempt); well done

content.content: 上出来、上出来(!)
Well done!―Splendid!―Bravo!
君は英語は上出来だが数学は不出来だ
You have done well in English, but badly in mathematics.
こりゃ上出来だ、僕にもこうはできない
You have done very well; I could not do it so well.
吉衛門は昨夜は上出来だった
Kichiemon was at his best last evening.
これならまず上出来の方だ
It is fairly well done.
写真はまず上出来だ
The photo is fairly well taken.
この作文はまず上出来の方だ
The composition is fairly well written.
君は感心な上出来だ
You have acquitted yourself to your credit.
これまでにない上出来だ
You have outdone yourself―surpassed yourself―eclipsed yourself.
この作文はこの前のよりも上出来だ
This composition is an improvement on your last.
今日は病人は上出来だ
The invalid is doing well today.

しょうてん〔商店〕
〈名〉A shop; a store; a firm; a commercial house; a mercantile house; a house of business

しょうてん〔掌典〕
〈名〉An official (of the Board of Ceremonies) in charge of festivals

content:
しょうてん〔昇天〕
〈名〉Ascension:(=する) to ascend to Heaven; to go to Heaven; to go to glory

content.content: (キリストの)昇天日
the Ascension Day―the Holy Thursday
(死を経ずして)生きながら昇天する
to be translated
彼は旭日昇天の勢いだ
He is a rising man―His star is in the ascendant.
社運は昇天の勢
The firm is rising to prosperity.

content:
しょうてん〔焦点〕
〈名〉A focus:(=の) focal

content.content: 日光を焦点に集める
to focus the rays on a point
日光が焦点に集まる
The rays focus on a point.
眼鏡の焦点を定める
to focus one's glasses on an object―bring one's glasses into focus―bring one's glasses to a focus
焦点内にあり、焦点外にあり
to be in focus―out of focus
彼は衆目の焦点となった
He was the focus of public attention―the cynosure of all eyes―the observed of all observers―Public attention was focussed upon him.
攻撃の焦点となった
He became the focus of attack―bore the brunt of the attack.
焦点距離
the focal distance

It does not pay to move in such a small sphere―to play on such a small stage.

to be confined within a limited sphere of activity―“cabined cribbed confined”

the Western Paradise

content.content: 消灯時間だ
It is “lights out.”
消灯ラッパが鳴る
“Lights out” is sounded.

content.content: せいとう〔正統〕

content:
しょうとう〔檣頭〕
〈名〉The mast-head

content.content: 檣頭に旗を揚げる
to hoist a flag at the mast-head
檣頭高く軍艦旗が翻っておった
The ensign was flying from the mast-head.
檣頭見張座
a crow's nest

content:
しょうどう〔唱道〕
〈名〉Advocacy:(=する) to advocate; to advance; to set forth; to espouse (a cause)

content.content: 新説を唱道する
to advocate a new doctrine―advance a new doctrine―set forth a new doctrine―broach a new theory
民主主義を唱道する
to advocate democracy―preach democracy―espouse the cause of democracy

content:
しょうどう〔衝動〕
〈名〉An impulse:(=する) to impel:(=的) impulsive

content.content: 衝動的の動作
an impulsive action
彼の行為は衝動的だ
He acts on the impulse of the movement.
彼は何事をするにもその時の衝動次第だ
He does everything on the impulse of the movement―on the spur of the movement.

content:
しょうどう〔聳動〕
〈名〉A shock:(=する) to shock; to startle; to electrify

content.content: 世の耳目を聳動する
to startle the world―electrify the world―make a stir―create a sensation―set the river on fire

content:
じょうとう〔上等〕
〈形〉High-class (society) ; first-class (hotel) ; first-rate (performance) ; the best (quality) ; superior (article) ; capital (dinner) ; choice (goods) ; prime (beef) ; swell (society) ; splendid (article) ; ripping (article) ; rattling (dinner) ; bully (clothes, etc.)

content.content: 上等品
a first-class article―a superior article―a choice article―a ripping article―an article of the best quality
上等社会
high-class society―swell society―the higher classes―the upper classes
上等船客
first-class passengers―cabin passengers―saloon passengers
(船の)上等室
a first-class cabin
特別上等室
the saloon
上等兵
a first-class private
上等の牛肉
prime beef
ご馳走は上等だった
It was a capital dinner―a splendid spread―a ripping spread―a rattling dinner.
も少し上等のは無いか
Haven't you any a little better?
これより上等のはありません
We have none better―This is the best we have.
上等、上等(!)
First-rate!―Capital!―Bully!
それで上等だ
That'll do.

じょうとう〔上騰〕
〈名〉Rise; ascension:(=する) to rise; to ascend

content:
じょうとう〔常套〕
〈形〉Commonplace; trite; hackneyed; conventional

content.content: 常套語
a trite saying―a hackneyed expression
常套手段をとる
to resort to commonplace means
この作は常套を脱している
The work is free from conventionalism―unconventional.
千篇一律常套を脱せず
It is monotonous and conventional.

じょうどう〔成道〕
〈名〉Spiritual enlightenment:(=する) to be spiritually enlightened; to drink the water of life

じょうとうしき〔上棟式〕
〈名〉The ceremony of laying the ridge-timber:(に相当するは)laying the corner-stone

content:
しょうとく〔生得〕
〈名〉Nature; natural constitution:(副詞に用いれば)by nature; naturally; constitutionally:(=の) natural (honesty); born (poet); inborn (genius); innate (idea); inbred (courtesy); inherent (quality); congenital (deformity); constitutional (weakness, etc.)

content.content: 彼は生得正直な人間だ
He is honest by nature.
生得の詩人だ
He is a born poet.
生得の天才を有す
He possesses an inborn genius.
生得観念
an innate idea
生得の不具
a congenital deformity
生得の虚弱
a constitutional weakness
生得権
birthright

content:
しょうどく〔消毒〕
〈名〉Disinfection; sterilization:(=する) to disinfect; to sterilize

content.content: 消毒を施す
to subject anything to disinfection
便所は消毒してあるか
Is the lavatory disinfected?
脱脂綿は消毒してある
The absorbent cotton is sterilized.
消毒脱脂綿
sterilized cotton
消毒牛乳
sterilized milk―pasteurized milk
日なたに干すのが何よりの消毒になる
To expose anything to the sun is the best disinfection.
日光消毒
disinfection by sunlight
硫黄消毒
sulphur disinfection―fumigation
燻蒸消毒
fumigation
燻蒸消毒する
to fumigate
消毒薬
a disinfectant
消毒所
a disinfecting station

content:
じょうとくい〔常得意〕
〈名〉A regular customer; a patron

content.content: あの方は私どもの常得意です
He is our patron―He patronizes us.

しょうとくひょう〔頌徳表〕
〈名〉A eulogy; an encomium; a panegyric

content:
しょうとつ〔衝突〕
〈名〉
1. (=物の衝突)a collision; a smash; a bump:(=する) to collide with, come into collision with (each other); to run into, smash into (a train); to bump, knock, run (one's head against the wall); to strike against, run against (a rock); to run foul of (a ship)

content.content: 船の衝突
a collision of ships
汽船日本丸は英国汽船タコマ号と長崎港口にて衝突し両船共に沈没せり
The Nippon Maru collided with―came into collision with―the British steamer, the Tacoma, and both ships went down.
軍艦が出港の際一汽船と衝突した
A warship, when leaving the harbour, ran foul of a steamer.
船長は両船間の衝突は免れないと見た
The captain saw that a collision was inevitable between the two ships.
名古屋丸は暗礁に衝突して沈没した
The Nagoya Maru struck against a rock, and went down.
汽船が小帆船に衝突してこれを沈めた
A steamer ran down a schooner.
汽車の衝突
a railway collision
大宮駅において貨物列車が客列車に衝突し多くの死傷者を出した
At Omiya station, a freight train ran into―went smash into―a passenger train, causing many casualties.
正面衝突
a head-on collision
二列車が正面衝突をした
There was a head-on collision between two trains.
飛行機がすさまじい音響を立てて木立に衝突した
An aeroplane crashed against―hurtled against―a thicket.

content: 2. (=人の衝突)a collision:(=する) to come into collision with (a man); to fall foul of (a man)

content.content: あの男は誰とでも衝突する
He will fall foul of everybody.
あの先生は時々生徒と衝突する
He has frequent troubles with the students.
なるべく人と衝突を避けるが好い
You ought to avoid collision with people as much as possible.

content: 3. (=軍の衝突)an encounter:(小衝突)a skirmish; a brush:(=する) to encounter, have a skirmish with, have a brush with (the enemy)

content.content: 斥候の衝突があった
There was a skirmish between the scouts.
ちょいと烈しい衝突であった
It was a smart skirmish.
今朝敵と小衝突あり
This morning, we had a brush with the enemy.

content: 4. (=かちあい)a conflict; a clash; a collision; interference:(=する) to conflict with, clash with, collide with, interfere with (each other); to run counter to (each other)

content.content: 時間が衝突する
The hours clash with each other.
君の計画は僕の計画と衝突している
Your plan conflicts with mine―Your plan is in conflict with mine―Your plan interferes with mine.
会が衝突して一方へ出席すると一方へ出席することができぬ
The meetings clash with each other, so that, if I attend one, I can not attend the other.
利益の衝突
a conflict of interests―a clash of interests―a collision of interests
彼我の利益が衝突する
Our interests conflict with theirs―Our interests clash with theirs―Our interests collide with theirs―Our interests run counter to theirs.
主義と利益と衝突する時はいずれを立つべきものか
When our principles run counter to our interests, which should we adhere to?
意見の衝突
a conflict of opinions―a clash of opinions―a collision of views―a difference of opinion
彼と少しく意見の衝突があった
I had a slight difference with him―a slight variance with him.
感情の衝突
a clash of feelings―a jar of feelings
二人の間に感情の衝突があったらしい
There seems to have been some jar between the two.
新旧思想の衝突
a conflict of old and new ideas―a clash between old and new ideas

しょうとりひき〔商取引〕
〈名〉A commercial transaction; a business transaction; a deal

〈名〉The inside of a castle:(名副詞に用いれば)within the walls of a castle

content.content: 君の家は城外か城内か
Do you live within or without the walls?

content:
じょうない〔場内〕
〈副〉In the grounds; in the hall

content.content: 場内かなえの沸くが如し
There was an uproar in the hall―The hall was in an uproar.
場内に売店あり
There are stalls in the grounds.

content:
しょうに〔小児〕
〈名〉A child; an infant

content.content: 彼は小児の時に両親に死に別れた
He lost his parents when he was a child―in his infancy.
僕は彼を小児の時から知っている
I have known him from a child.
小児科
pediatrics

しょうにか〔小児科〕
〈名〉Pediatrics

content.content: 小児科医
a pediatrist

content.content: しょうにゅうとう〔鍾乳洞〕

content:
しょうにん〔商人〕
〈名〉(卸売商、貿易商、問屋などは)a merchant:(店を持つ小売商は)a tradesman:(集合的に言えば)tradespeople

content.content: 僕は商人になりたい
I wish to be a merchant―I aspire to commercial honours―I am an aspirant to commercial honours.
彼は商人になった
He has become a merchant―entered upon a commercial career.
商人根性、商人気質
a sordid spirit―a mercenary spirit
彼は商人根性を遺憾無く発揮している
He displays his sordid spirit in all its naked glory.

content:
しょうにん〔承認〕
〈名〉
1. (=認めること)admission; acknowledgment; recognition:(=する) to admit (a fact); to acknowledge (one's error, mistake, fault, defeat, inferiority―oneself to be mistaken, wrong, in the wrong, inferior, defeated, etc.); to acknowledge, allow (another's superiority―another as one's superior―one to be a great man); to recognize (the independence of a country―a country as an independent state, etc.)

content.content: (なるほどごもっともと人の言う)事実を承認する
to admit a fact
君の言わるることの事実なることは承認する
I admit the truth of your statement.
彼は自己の誤謬を承認した
He has acknowledged his error―acknowledged himself to be mistaken.
敗北を承認した
He has acknowledged his defeat―acknowledged himself to be beaten.
自分の方が悪かったことを承認した
He has acknowledged himself in the wrong.
自己の過失を承認した(自分が悪かったと言って謝った)
He has acknowledged his fault.
彼の大家なることを承認する
I acknowledge him as an authority.
彼は世間から英学者として承認されている
He is acknowledged as an English scholar.
彼の博学は万人の承認するところである
His erudition is acknowledged by everybody.
彼の偉いことは万人が承認している
His greatness is acknowledged on all hands―acknowledged by everybody―Everybody acknowledges him to be a great man―allows him to be a great man.
僕は彼を長者として承認せぬ
I do not acknowledge him as my superior.
彼を正当の主人として承認せぬ
I do not recognize him as my lawful master.
一国の独立を承認する
to recognize the independence of a country―recognize a country as an independent state
日本は支那の共和国を承認せざるを得なかった
Japan had to recognize China as a republic.
日本政府はようやくロシアの労農政府を承認した
At last Japan has recognized the Soviet government.

content: 2. (=承引)consent:(=する) to consent (to or to do something)

content.content: 左記の諸君は本会の賛助員たることを承認せられたり
The following gentlemen have consented to be supporters of the present association.

content: 3. (=認可)approval:(=する) to approve (a measure, etc.)

content.content: これは大臣の承認を受けた処置である
The measure has been approved by the Minister.
知事の承認を経て定めた事項である
These items have been decided upon with the approval of the Governor.

content:
しょうにん〔証人〕
〈名〉A witness; a deponent

content.content: 証人になる
to depose to a fact―testify to a fact―bear witness to a fact
彼が無罪なことは僕が証人だ
I can testify to―bear witness to―his innocence.
証人を召喚する
to summon a witness
証人として召喚する
to summon one as witness―call one in evidence―call one in testimony
裁判の時僕は証人として召喚された
I was summoned as witness―called in evidence―at the trial.
証人として法廷に立った
I appeared in court as witness.
(弁護人が)証人を調べる
to examine a witness―(相手方の証人なら)―cross-examine a witness
証人席
the witness-box

content:
しょうにん〔上人〕
〈名〉
1. (=ひじり)a saint

content.content: 日蓮上人
Saint Nichiren.

content: 2. (=僧侶の尊称)your reverence; his reverence

しょうにん〔陞任〕
〈名〉Promotion:(=する) to be promoted

content.content: 高等官一等に陞任した
He has been promoted to first-grade senior official.

しようにん〔使用人〕
〈名〉An employ?; an employee; a servant

content:
じょうにん〔上人〕
〈名〉A good-natured man

content.content: 彼女の夫は仏さまのような上人だ
Her husband is a saint of a man.

content:
しょうにんずう〔少人数〕
〈名〉A small number of men; a handful of men

content.content: 手前どもは少人数です
We are a small family.
王は少人数の兵を率いて大敵を喰い止めた
The king checked the surging enemy at the head of a mere handful of men.

content:
しょうね〔性根〕
〈名〉(One's) essential nature, essential quality, metal

content.content: 彼は性根が正直だ
He is made of true metal.
性根の悪い奴だ
He is made of base metal.
性根が曲っている
He is of a perverse nature―of a crabbed nature―a cross-grained fellow.
性根の知れない男だ
He is an enigma―a sphinx.
性根の腐った女だ
Her heart is rotten to the core.
性根を据えてよく聴け
Listen to me with attention!
彼は酒を飲むと性根を失う
He will drink away his reason.
酒に性根を奪われる
Wine steals aways one's brains.
性根を入れ換える
to reform―amend―mend one's ways―turn over a new leaf

content:
じょうねつ〔情熱〕
〈名〉Passion

content.content: 情熱に満ちた詩
impassioned poetry
Byron の詩は情熱があふれている
Byron's poems are overflowing with passion.

content:
しょうねつじごく〔焦熱地獄〕
〈名〉Hell-fire; Gehenna

content.content: この世からなる焦熱地獄
It is Hell on earth.

content:
しょうねん〔少年〕
〈名〉A boy; a lad:(=の) juvenile

content.content: 少年時代
one's boyhood
少年時代に英語を学んだ
I learned my English when I was a boy―in my boyhood.
少年時代は田舎で暮らした
I passed my boyhood in the provinces.
彼は少年時代から語学の才が有った
He showed an aptitude for languages from his boyhood upward.
少年老いやすく学成り難し
“Art is long, and life is short.”
少年文学
juvenile literature
少年義勇団
the Boy Scouts

しょうのう〔小脳〕
〈名〉The cerebellum

content:
しょうのう〔小農〕
〈名〉A small farmer; a petty farmer; a peasant proprietor

content.content: 小農階級
the peasantry
小農地
small proprietary land
小農組織
the peasant-proprietary system
小農制度
the intensive agricultural system

content:
しょうのう〔樟脳〕
〈名〉Camphor

content.content: 樟脳精
spirit of camphor
樟脳油
oil of camphor

content:
しょうのう〔笑納〕
〈名〉Your acceptance

content.content: 乍些少御笑納被下度候{さしょうながらごしょうのうくだされたくそうろう}
I beg you will accept―I request your acceptance of―the accompanying trifle.

じょうのう〔上納〕
〈名〉Payment to the government:(=する) to pay (to the government); to pay in

content:
しようのない〔仕様の無い〕
〈形〉Good-for-nothing; past praying for; irredeemable; irreclaimable; incorrigible

content.content: あれはしようのない奴だ
He is a dead-beat.
何をさしても役に立たないしようのない男だ
He is a good-for-nothing (fellow).
幾度失錯をしても懲り性の無いしようのない奴だ(済度し難い)
He is past praying for―past redemption―irredeemable―irreclaimable―incorrigible.
酒ばかり飲んでしようのない奴だ
He is a sad dog―a scapegrace.
生意気でしようのない子だ
She is too conceited for anything―conceited enough for everybody.
おせっかいばかりしてしようのない男だ
He is a meddler―a busybody.

content:
じょうば〔乗馬〕
〈名〉
1. (=馬乗り)riding:(=する) to mount a horse; to get on a horse

content.content: 乗馬(!)
Mount!―To horse!
乗馬術
riding―horsemanship―equitation―man?ge
乗馬学校
a riding-school―a man?ge
乗馬教官
a riding-master
乗馬隊
a mounted corps
乗馬歩兵
mounted infantry
乗馬服
a riding-dress―(婦人のは)―a riding-habit

content: 2. (=乗り馬)a riding-horse; a saddle-horse; a mount; a hack; a palfrey (for ladies)

content.content: 彼の乗馬は白の軍馬であった
He was mounted on a white charger.
英国の騎兵は乗馬が好い
The British cavalry are well mounted.
日本の騎兵は乗馬が悪い
The Japanese cavalry are poorly mounted.

content:
しょうはい〔勝敗〕
〈名〉Victory or defeat; success (in battle); the issue (of a battle); the event (of a game)

content.content: 両軍勝敗を争う
The two armies contend for victory―strive for mastery.
勝敗を決する
to fight to a finish―fight to the finish―fight it out―(無意志に用いれば)―decide a battle―decide the day
勝敗決せり
The day is decided.
援兵が来たので勝敗がきまった
The arrival of reinforcements decided the day.
勝敗疑わし
The day is doubtful.
勝敗決し難し
It is a doubtful battle―a doubtful day―a close contest―a near contest―The day is doubtful―Victory hangs in doubt―Victory hangs in suspense―Victory hangs in the balance.
勝敗を決するまで戦う
We will fight to finish.
今度こそは勝敗を決する
We will fight to the finish this time.
勝敗を一戦に決する
to fight a decisive battle
勝敗は最後の五分にあり
The last five minutes decides the battle.
勝敗のまさに分かれんとする瞬間だ
It is the moment when the day is about to be decided.
両軍互いに勝敗あり
The two armies fight with varying fortunes―The tide of war wavers between the contending armies.
勝敗は必しも兵数の多少によるものにあらず
Success in battle does not always depend on numbers.
勝敗は時の運
Victory or defeat is due to chance of war―“It is not in mortals to command success.”
勝敗は兵家の常
Victory or defeat is incidental to warfare.
一時の勝敗に心を悩ますなかれ
Do not distress yourself about the daily incidents of warfare!
勝敗の数はいかに
How are the chances?―What are the odds?

しょうはい〔賞盃〕
〈名〉A prize-cup

content:
しょうはい〔賞牌〕
〈名〉A medal

content.content: 賞牌を取る
to win a medal
彼は平和博で賞牌を授与された
He was awarded a medal at the Peace Exhibition.
賞牌受領者
a medallist

content:
しょうばい〔商売〕
〈名〉
1. (=商業)commerce; trade; business; traffic; commercial pursuits; mercantile pursuits:(=する) to engage in commerce; to carry on commerce; to carry on trade; to do business; to traffic

content.content: ご商売は
What is your business?―What line of business are you engaged in?―What do you deal in?
私の商売は呉服屋です
I am a draper.
商売をする
to engage in commerce―carry on commerce―carry on trade―prosecute a trade―drive a trade―engage in business―do business―run a business―conduct a business
彼は商売をしている
He is doing business―in business―engaged in business.
商売をするなら資本を出してやろう
If you engage in business,―go into business,―I will furnish you with capital.
資本無しで商売する
to do business without capital―“make bricks without straw”―“live by one's wits”
あの人は資本無しの商売だ
He lives by his wits.
彼は主人から暇を取って独立に商売をしている
He has left his master's service, and is doing business for himself―doing business on his own account.
彼は月に一万円の商売をする
He does business to the amount of 10,000 yen a month―He turns over 10,000 yen a month.
商売をして成功した(失敗した)
He has succeeded in business―failed in business.
商売をして儲けた(損をした)
He has gained by his business―lost by his business.
彼は商売をして身代をこしらえた
He has made a fortune by commerce―by trade―by business.
商売を始める
to go into business―take to business―set up in business―start a business
彼は主人から暇を取って独立に商売を始めた
He has left his master's service, and set up for himself.
僕は素手で(手始めの資本無しに)商売を始めた
I went into business with nothing to start with―I started with nothing.
商売が繁昌する
to do good business―drive a good trade
ご商売はご繁昌ですか
How is your business doing?
商売は繁昌かと尋ねた
I inquired after his business.
商売はかなり繁昌です
My business is doing pretty well.
彼は商売が大繁昌だ
He drives a roaring trade.
商売は場所で繁昌する
Business depends on the locality―The locality brings the business.
家内安全商売繁昌
Peace to the household and prosperity to the business!
商売が忙しい
Business is brisk.
商売が暇だ
Business is slack―Trade is dull―Trade is languid.
商売がまるっきり暇だ
We do no business at all―Trade is at a low ebb.
商売がパッタリ止まった
Trade is at a standstill.
本屋の商売は夏は全く暇です
The bookseller's trade is at a standstill in summer.
あの人は商売が上手だ
He is a good man of business.
彼はこの商売に明るい
He is versed in the business―conversant with the business.
彼は商売仲間だ
He is in the business―in the trade―in the line.
商売の方では彼と関係が無い
I have no relations with him in the way of business.
商売になるか
Does it pay?
こう安く売っては商売にならない
It doesn't pay to sell so cheap.
商売を止める
to give up one's business―retire from business―shut up shop
彼は商売を止めて楽隠居の身だ
He has retired from business, and lives at his ease.
僕は商売を止めてばかなことをした
I committed a folly in giving up my business.
不景気のために商売を止めた商人がある
Some tradesmen have shut up shop owing to the badness of the times.
彼は息子に商売を譲って隠居した
He has made over his business to his son, and retired from active life.
(英国では)何商売でも日曜には休むか
Do all shops close on Sunday?
商売は商売だから
Business is business.

content: 2. (=職業)an occupation; a calling; a business; a trade; a profession

content.content: あの人は商売は何だ
What is his business?―What is his trade?―What is his profession?
彼はきまった商売が無い
He has no regular occupation―He lives by his wits.
商売は大工だ
He is a carpenter by trade.
ばくちが商売だ
He is a gambler by profession.
商売を覚える
to learn a trade
彼は石切りの商売を覚えた
He has learned the stone-cutter's trade.
商売はみっちり覚えなくてはならない
You must learn your trade well.
商売の秘訣を覚える
to learn the tricks of the trade―be initiated into the mysteries of the trade
子どもに商売を仕込む
to train a boy to some trade―bring up a boy to some trade
子どもに商売を仕込まぬ者は賊を養う
One who brings up his boy to nothing, breeds a thief.
商売を励む
to give one's mind to business―to be enthusiastic in one's business
彼は穴探しを商売にしている
He makes it his business to find faults in others.
私は道楽に釣りをするのではない商売です
I do not fish for pleasure, but as a business―for a living.
昼間寝て夜働く商売がある
Some people sleep by day and work by night.
彼は処を嫌わず商売の話を出しかける
He talks shops wherever he goes.
一般の人と話をする時は商売の話を出すな
Sink the shop in talking with ordinary people.
彼は商売の臭味が抜けない
He smells of the shop.
人間商売
the business of life
商売共仇敵
“Two of a trade never agree.”
商売は道によって賢し(商売は門々)
“Every man to his trade.”

content:
しょうばいがえ〔商売換え〕
〈名〉Change of business; change of occupation

content.content: 僕は商売換えをするつもりだ
I am going to change my business―take to some other occupation.

content:
しょうばいがたき〔商売仇敵〕
〈名〉
1. (=同業者の反目)professional rivalry; professional jealousy
2. (=反目せる同業者)rivals in trade; two of a trade

content.content: 二人は商売仇敵だから仲が悪い
They can not agree, for they are two of a trade.
あれは君の商売仇敵だろう
He is your rival in trade, isn't he?

content:
しょうばいがら〔商売柄〕
〈名〉The nature of one's business

content.content: 商売柄だからしかたがない
It is in the nature of his business.
商売柄で如才無い
His business teaches him savoir faire.
さすがは商売柄で抜け目が無い
His business makes him shrewd.
弁護士は商売柄でうまいことを言う
A lawyer has professional wit.

content:
しょうばいぎ〔商売気〕
〈名〉A commercial spirit; a desire for gain; interest

content.content: 女は商売気を離れて男に尽した
She served him apart from interest.

content:
しょうばいすじ〔商売筋〕
〈名〉A line of business

content.content: ご商売筋は
What line of business are you engaged in?

content:
しょうばいちがい〔商売違い〕
〈形〉(Something) out of one's line

content.content: その問題は商売違いだ
The question is not in my line―out of my line―out of my beat.

しょうばいどうぐ〔商売道具〕
〈名〉The tools of one's trade; stock-in-trade

content:
しょうばいなかま〔商売仲間〕
〈名〉People of the same trade; people in the same business

content.content: 僕も商売仲間だ(からだまされぬ)
I am in the line―in the business―in the trade―myself.

content:
しょうばいにん〔商売人〕
〈名〉A professional; a connoisseur; an adept; an expert; one in the line:(女なら)a professional woman

content.content: この手際なら商売人と言っても恥ずかしくない

これなら商売人も跣足だ
It would put a professional to shame.
彼は書画にかけては商売人だ
He is a connoisseur of art―an adept in art.
彼はその道の商売人だ(からだませぬ)
He is in the line―in the business―in the trade.
あれは商売人のばくち打ちだ
He is a professional gambler.
本物かどうかは商売人にはわかる
The genuineness of the article is clear to the professional eye―clear to the trained eye.
商売人の目は盗めぬ
One can not deceive a professional eye―The blemish can not escape a trained eye.

content:
しょうばいぶり〔商売振り〕
〈名〉One's business method

content.content: 彼は商売ぶりがなかなか奇抜だ
His business method is quite original.

〈名〉The upper arm

〈名〉A letter-box; a letter-case

じょうばさみ〔状挟み〕
〈名〉A letter-clip

〈名〉Reward and punishment; justice

content.content: 賞罰を行う
to reward merit and punish crime―satisfy justice
賞罰を明らかにする
to fulfil justice
賞罰を明らかにせねばならぬ
Justice must be fulfilled.
偏頗な賞罰
partial rewards and punishments
賞罰そのよろしきを得
Rewards and punishments are justly administered―Justice is satisfied.
(履歴書などの)賞罰無し
No reward or punishment.

じょうはつ〔蒸発〕
〈名〉Evaporation:(=する) to evaporate

Alcohol is volatile.

content.content: 松柏科の木
a coniferous tree―a conifer

a cooperative society

an imminent danger―an emergency―an exigency

content:

content.content: 常備軍
a standing army
常備軍付き
to serve with the colours

a man serving with the colours
常備艦隊
a standing squadron

rise stored in the public granary

しようひこうき〔四葉飛行機〕
〈名〉A quadriplane

content:
しょうひょう〔商標〕
〈名〉A trade-mark; a brand

content.content: 物品の商標
the trade-mark on an article
物品に商標を付ける
to brand an article
登録商標
a registered trade-mark
商標を侵害する
to pirate a trade-mark
商標侵害
piracy of a trade-mark―trade-mark piracy

しょうひょう〔証憑〕
〈名〉Proof; evidence

じょうひょう〔上表〕
〈名〉A memorial to the Throne:(=する) to memorialize the Throne

〈名〉The sick and wounded

content.content: 傷病兵を後送する
The sick and wounded are sent to the rear.

content:
しょうひん〔商品〕
〈名〉An article of commerce; a commodity:(総称すれば)goods; commodities; merchandise:(店に仕入れてある商品)stock

content.content: どんな種類の商品をお取扱いになりますか
What line of goods do you deal in?
この品は商品になる、商品にならぬ
The article is marketable―unmarketable.
商品を仕入れる
to lay in a stock of goods
商品仕入帳
an invoice book (inwards)
商品仕送帳
an invoice book outwards
現在商品
goods in stock―stock in hand
主要商品
staple commodities
商品陳列館
a commercial museum
商品陳列室
a show-room
商品陳列窓
a show-window
商品見本
sample of goods
商品見本郵便
sample post
商品切手、商品券
a presentation ticket―an exchange check
商品取引所
a produce exchange

しょうひん〔小品〕
〈名〉A short piece of work; a literary sketch

content:
しょうひん〔賞品〕
〈名〉A prize

content.content: 賞品を取る
to win a prize
賞品を授与する
to award one a prize

content:
しょうひん〔賍品〕
〈名〉Stolen goods

content.content: 賍品故買
receiving stolen goods
賍品故買者
a receiver of stolen goods―a fence

content:
じょうひん〔上品〕
〈形〉Refined (tastes); fine (lady); polished (manners); elegant (dress); graceful (figure); high-toned (society); high-bred (company); genteel (appearance); classic (features); delicate (nurture); dainty (food); distinguished (air, etc.)

content.content: 上品な人だ
He is a man of refined manners―a refined gentleman―a fine gentleman.
上品な婦人だ
She is a refined lady―a fine lady.
天性上品な人だ
He is a man of fine fibre.
上品なふうをしている
He has a refined air―a distinguished air―polished manners.
あの人は嗜好が上品だ
He is a man of refined tastes.
上品な言葉を使う
He uses chaste and refined language.
婦人は上品な支度をしている
She is elegantly dressed.
彼は上品な生い立ちだ
He is delicately nurtured―high-bred.
どことなく上品なところがある
There is something refined about him.
上品な遊び
refined pleasures
上品な社会
hight-toned society
上品な一座
a high-bred company
上品な目鼻立ち
classic features
上品な柄
elegant pattern
お上品ぶる
to be squeamish

しょうふ〔生麩〕
〈名〉A starch (obtained from wheat)

content:
しょうぶ〔勝負〕
〈名〉
1. (=勝敗)victory or defeat; the issue (of a battle); the event (of a match)

content.content: 勝負をつける
to decide the contest―decide the day
勝負がついた、勝負があった
The contest is decided.
援兵が来たので勝負がついた
The arrival of reinforcements decided the day.
勝負のつくまでやる
I will fight to a finish―play the game out.
容易に勝負がつかない
It is a close game―a close contest―a near contest.
とうとう勝負がつかない
It is a drawn game―a drawn match.
勝負無し
a draw―a tie
相撲の勝負表
a wrestling-match score

content: 2. (=勝敗を争うこと)a game; a match; a bout; a contest; a fight:(=する) to play; to fight; to contest; to have a game; to have a match; to have a bout; to try conclusions with (one)

content.content: 手に汗を握って勝負を眺めておった
We were watching the contest with breathless interest.
一勝負やろうか
Will you have a game?
一勝負やってみよう
I will have a game―try my luck.
勝負(掛け声)
Game!
どちらが強いか勝負してみよう
We will see which is the better man―see which of us is master.
いざ勝負せん
Come, let me try conclusions with you!
段が違うから勝負にならぬ
There is no comparison between the two, and it will be no match.
勝負に勝つ、勝負に負ける
to win a game―lose a game
勝負は君の勝ちだ
You have won the game―The game is yours.
勝負は僕の負けだ
I have lost the game.
今日の勝負は君の勝ちだ
You have won the day―The day is yours.
今日の勝負は僕の負けだ
I have lost the day.
勝負を投げる
to give up the game―throw up the sponge
尋常に勝負する
to play fair―play the game
尋常に勝負
Give me a fair chance!
尋常に勝負をした
It was a fair field and no favour―a clear stage and no favour.
尋常に勝負をして取った獲物だ
It is a prize won in fair fight.
おっつかつの勝負だ
It is a close game―a close contest―a near contest.
見込みの無い勝負だ
It is a losing game.
金を賭けて勝負する、金を賭けずに勝負する
to play for money―play for love
三番勝負
a three-game match―(トランプなら)―a robber of whist
一六勝負
a game of chance―gambling
一六勝負する
to gamble―take the chances―take the risks
真剣の勝負
a fight with real swords
真剣の勝負をする
to fight with real swords―fight hilt to hilt―cross swords with one
相撲の勝負
a wrestling match―a wrestling bout―a fall
相撲の勝負をする
to wrestle―try a fall
相撲の勝負を預かる
to leave a match undecided

content:
しょうぶ〔尚武〕
〈名〉Militarism

content.content: 尚武の気象
a military spirit―a martial spirit―a warlike spirit
尚武の気象を養う
to foster a military spirit in the people―martialize the people
国民は尚武の気象に富む

1. (=花菖蒲)the iris
2. (=五月の菖蒲)the sweet-flag; the sweet-sedge

じょうふ〔上布〕

content:

content.content: 丈夫またこれ涙無きにあらず

content:

content.content: 彼は人に接するに城府を設ける、城府を設けぬ

content:

content.content: 情夫をこしらえる

content:
じょうぶ〔丈夫〕
〈形〉
1. (=強壮)strong; healthy; robust; hardy; hale and hearty

content.content: 父は丈夫です
My father is in good health―He enjoys good health―He is in the enjoyment of good health.
君も丈夫で結構だ
I am glad you are in robust health.
老人はまだ丈夫だ
The old man is hale and hearty.
彼は丈夫な質だ
He has a strong constitution―He is blessed with an iron constitution.
丈夫になる
to gain in health
丈夫なのは何よりだ

僕は足が丈夫だ

胃が丈夫だ

うちの男は非常に丈夫だ

I will answer for its durability.
靴は丈夫一方にこしらえてもらいたい
I want my shoes made for wear and not for show.

content.content: 衝風炉
a blast-furnace

しょうふく〔慴伏〕
〈名〉Prostration for fear:(=する) to prostrate oneself for fear

じょうぶくろ〔状袋〕
〈名〉An envelope

content:
しょうぶごと〔勝負事〕
〈名〉
1. (=競技)a game; a sport:(総称すれば)sporting

content.content: 勝負事をする
to play a game―have a game
僕は勝負事はしない主義だ
I make it a rule to play no games.
彼は何でも勝負事が上手だ

content:

content.content: 正札を付ける

〈名〉
1. (=立証)proof; evidence; testimony; witness; demonstration:(=する) to prove (a fact); to demonstrate (a theory); to establish (one's innocence); to substantiate, make good (one's statement); to seal (one's devotion):(無意志なら)to prove, be proof of, be evidence of, witness, bear witness to, testify to, show, bespeak, argue (a fact); to bear out, support, corroborate, confirm (one's statement)

content.content: その事実を証明することができるか
Can you prove the fact?

この事実は僕の言を証明するに足る

この学説は証明することができるか

この事実は彼の無罪なることを証明している

The fact shows his innocence―shows that he is innocent―proves his innocence―is proof of his innocence―is proof that he is innocent―is evidence of his innocence―witnesses his innocence―bears witness to his innocence―testifies to his innocence.
ここに僕の説を証明する書類がある
Here are some documents proving my assertion―in proof of my assertion―that bear out my statement―that support my statement.
ここに彼の無罪を証明する事実がある

空屋の多いのが世間の不景気を証明している

彼の廉潔なことは彼の貧窮が証明している

彼の修養のあることは彼の文章が証している

content:
しらせ〔知らせ〕
〈名〉
1. (=報知)information; intelligence; notice; notification; advice; news; tidings:(=る) to inform, apprise, advice, notify (one of some event); to tell (one of some event―one that something has happened); to acquaint (one with some event); to let (one) know; to make known (one's wants); to give (one) notice of (anything)

content.content: 君が来たことを彼に知らせておいた
I have informed him of your arrival―told him of your arrival―told him that you have arrived.
彼に及第したことを知らせてやれ
You must inform him of his success―acquaint him with his success.
彼が死んだという知らせがあった
I was informed of his death―I had notice of his death―I received intelligence of his death.
彼が来るという知らせが無かった
I was not told of his coming―I was not notified of his coming.
差し当たって心当たりは無いがもしあったら知らせよう
I can't think of any one at this moment, but, if I hear of one, I will let you know.
先へ着いたら知らしてくれ給え
You must write and let me know when you arrive.
手紙で知らせる
to inform one by letter
口上で知らせる
to inform one by word of mouth
家を明けて欲しい時は前もってお知らせします
When I want the house vacated, I will give you previous notice.
一週間前に知らせて下さい
Please give me a week's notice.
止める時は一カ月前に知らせて下さい
Please give me a month's notice when you wish to leave.
今日行くということを電報で知らせておいた
I have wired him that I am coming today.
その事を電話で知らして来た
He has phoned me of the circumstance.
知っていたけれども誰にも知らせなかった
I kept the knowledge from everybody―I kept the knowledge to myself.
彼にも秘密を知らせておく必要がある
We must let him into the secret.

content: 2. (=前兆)an omen; a foreboding; a presentiment; a warning

to forebode―have a foreboding―have a presentiment―Something within me tells me
君が来るだろうと思った、やはり虫が知らせたのだ
I had a foreboding―had a presentiment―that you would come.
何事かありそうに虫が知らせる
I have a foreboding―Something within me tells me―that something is going to happen.
彼は虫が知らせて自分の死ぬことを知ったものとみえる
He seems to have foreboded his own death.

content:
しらべ〔調べ〕
〈名〉
1. (=調査)investigation; examination; inquiry:(=る) to investigate (a matter); to examine (the prisoner); to inquire into, look into, go into, examine into (a case); to look over, go over, run over, look through (papers); to consult, refer to (a dictionary); to study up, read up (a subject); to make out (a bill); to search (the room); to trace (one's career); to count (the number)

content.content: 一つ調べておこう
I will look into the matter.
充分に調べる
to investigate a matter thoroughly―probe the matter to the bottom
緻密に調べる
to investigate a matter closely―sift the matter to a crumb
原因を調べてみよう
I will inquire into the cause.
原因を調べてもわからぬ
I can not find out the cause.
事実を調べる
to inquire into the facts of the case
被害高を調べる
to inquire into the damage done―count damages
戸籍を調べる
to take the census
戸籍調べ
census-taking
人の戸籍調べをする
to inquire into one's census register―(もとを洗うの意味なら)―inquire into one's origin
身元を調べる
to inquire into one's birth and parentage―ascertain one's birth and parentage
その人を雇う前に人物を調べなかったのが悪い
You ought to have inquired into the man's character before employing him.
勘定を調べる
(勘定書きを出すためなら)to make out a bill―(勘定書きを見てなら)―look over the accounts.
勘定を調べてみたが合っている
I have looked over the accounts, and found them correct.
勘定をザッと調べてみた
I have run over the accounts.
間違いは無いつもりだがいまいちおう調べてみよう
I think it is all right, but I will go over it once more.
書類を調べる(目を通す)
to look over the papers―look through the papers
試験の答案を調べなければならん
I have some examination-paper to look over.
字書を調べる
to consult a dictionary―refer to a dictionary
この言葉は字書を調べたか
Have you looked up the word in your dictionary?
字書を調べてもこの言葉が無い
I can not find the word in my dictionary.
試験の準備に歴史を調べる
to study up history for the examination
試験の用意に調べておかなければならぬ本がある
I must read up some books for the examination.
明日の課業を調べておかねばならぬ
I must read up for tomorrow―study up for tomorrow.
人数を調べる
to count the number of men―tell noses
金を調べて受取ったのか
Did you count the money when you received it?
被告を調べる
to examine the prisoner
僕らは校長室へ呼ばれて調べられた
We were examined before the principal.
室内を調べる
to search the room
税関で手荷物を調べられた
My luggage was searched at the custom-house.
人の経歴を調べる
to trace one's career
系図を調べる
to trace one's pedigree (up to one's ancestor)
彼の系図を調べてみると先祖は天皇だ
His pedigree is to be traced to an Emperor.
この習慣の由来を調べてみると仏教から来ている
The custom is to be traced to Buddhism.
この辞典の解釈はよく調べてある
The definitions of this dictionary are results of careful investigation.

content:
しり〔尻〕
〈名〉
1. The buttocks; the hips; the nates; the posterior(s); the arse; the bottom; the seat; the backside; the fundament

content.content: 尻を振る
to sway one's bottom from side to side
尻の穴

尻の穴が小さい
to be small-minded―narrow-minded
尻の穴の毛まで抜く
to fleece one of everything
尻の穴の毛まで抜かれる
to be fleeced of everything
尻を拭く
to use toilet-paper
人の尻を拭う
to repair another's blunder
人に尻を向けて坐る
to sit with one's back toward another
お尻を向けてご免下さい
Excuse my turning my back toward you!
尻をはしょる、尻をからげる
to tuck up one's skirt
尻を捲くる
to roll up one's skirt―bare one's buttocks
その男は尻をまくって動かなかった
He sat down doggedly at the entrance and would not move till he gained his end.
女の尻を追う
to pursue a woman―dangle after a girl―dangle about a girl
尻を据える
to settle down in a place
尻が据わっている
He is settled in the place.
尻を持って行く
to complain to one
いまさら尻の持って行き処が無い
We have no one to complain to now.
尻が来る
to have a complain from some one―have to bear the consequences of another's fault
お前達があまり暴れるものだから隣から尻が来た
You kicked up such a racket that I had a complaint from my neighbour.
社員に不都合があると会社へ尻が来る
The company must bear the consequences of its servants' irregularities.
お前達が物をこわすと皆俺の方へ尻が来る
If you break things, I must pay for them―they are put to my account.
尻が割れる
to be discovered―be found out
悪事の尻を割る
to disclose a crime―reveal a crime
あの人は尻が長い
He always stays long.
あの女は尻が軽い
She is wanton―skittish―light―prodigal of her favours―a light-skirts―a lady of easy virtue.
尻が重い
She is lazy―She won't budge (an inch).
あの人は尻が落ち着かない
He can not stay long in one place―He is a rolling stone.
尻に帆をかける
to show one's heels―show a clean pair of heels
尻に帆をかけて逃げ出した
He took to his heels.
尻を逆さまにして逃げる
to scamper away
亭主を尻に敷く
to henpeck one's husband―wear the breeches
米国では女が亭主を尻に敷く
The wife wears the breeches in America.
彼は女房の尻に敷かれている
He is a henpecked husband―tied to his wife's apron-strings.
尻に火がつくよう
to be pressed by business
あの男のすることは尻に締まりが無い
He leaves things half-done.
人の尻につく
to play second fiddle
尻でもなめろ
Kiss my arse!
頭隠して尻隠さず
ostrich policy

content:
2. (=牛などの尻)the rump:(馬の尻)the crupper:(ズボンの尻)the seat(of trousers):(徳利の尻)the bottom (of a bottle):(縄の尻)the end (of a rope):(行列の尻)the tail (of a procession)
3. (=末席)the bottom (of a class, etc.)

content.content: 彼は尻から二番目で及第した
He has passed last but one on the list.
尻から五番目で卒業した
He has graduated fifth from the bottom.

content:
じり〔事理〕
〈名〉
1. (=物事の道理)the reason of things

content.content: 彼は事理を解する、事理を弁えている
He has good sense―He is sensible―He is a man of sense.
事理を解さぬ
He lacks sense―He is devoid of sense.

content: 2. (=事実)facts

content.content: 事理明白
The facts of the case are clear.

content:
じり〔自利〕
〈名〉Egoism; self-interest

content.content: 自利を図る
to consult one's own interests―have an eye to the main chance―take care of No.1
自利的な人だ
He is a selfish man―a self-seeking man―a self-seeker―an egoist.

content:
しりあい〔知合い〕
〈名〉An acquaintance

content.content: 彼とは知り合いです
I am acquainted with him.
いささかの知り合いです
I am slightly acquainted with him.
彼とはお知り合いですか
Are you acquainted with him?―Do you know him personally?
人と知り合いになる
to become acquainted with one―make one's acquaintance
どこで知り合いになったか
Where did you make his acquaintance?
どうして知り合いになったか
How did you become acquainted with him?―How came you to know him?
ふとしたことから知り合いになった
We became acquainted by chance―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Chance made us acquainted.
彼とは昨今の知り合いではない
Our acquaintance is of no short standing.
久しい(多年の)知り合いだ
Our acquaintance is of long standing―of many years' standing.
あの人は知り合いが多い(交際が広い)
He has a large circle of acquaintance.
知り合いの英国人
an Englishman of my acquaintance

content:
しりあう〔知り合う〕
〈自動〉To know each other; to be acquainted with each other

content.content: 二人は互いに心を知り合っている
They understand each other.

content:
しりあがり〔尻上がり〕
〈名〉A rising inflection

content.content: 尻上りにものを言う
to speak with a rising inflection

content:
しりうまにのる〔尻馬に乗る〕
〈自動〉To follow the lead (of another); to follow (others) blindly; to follow suit

content.content: 僕は人の尻馬に乗るのはいやだ
I don't like to follow the lead of others.
彼は人の尻馬に乗って騒いでいる
He is a blind follower.
あの男は尻馬に乗りたがる
He is of a sequacious disposition.

しりえ〔後方〕
〈名〉The back; the rear:(=に) backward; rearward; behind

content:
しりおし〔尻押し〕
〈名〉(事)support; backing; abetment; instigation:(人)a supporter; a backer; an abettor; an instigator:(=する) to support; to back; to abet; to instigate; to set (one) on; to edge (one) on; to egg (one) on; to be at one's back; to be at the bottom of (an affair)

content.content: 女には誰か尻押しが付いているに違いない
She must have some one at her back.
この事件には誰か尻押しがあるに違いない
There must be some one at the bottom of the affair.
この事件の尻押しはたいがいわかっている
I have a shrewd guess as to who is at the bottom of the affair.
彼は誰か尻押しする者がありそうだ
He seems to be abetted―instigated―set on―edged on―egged on―by some one.

しりおとし〔尻落し〕
〈名〉(=飛行機の尻落し)A tail slide

しりがい〔鞦〕
〈名〉(=馬の鞦)A crupper

content:
しりがる〔尻軽〕
〈形〉Wanton; light; skittish; prodigal of her favour

content.content: 尻軽な女だ
She is a light-skirts―a lady of easy virtue.

content:
じりき〔自力〕
〈名〉One's own power; one's own exertions; one's own merit; self-reliance

content.content: 彼は自力で出世した
He has risen by his own merit.
自力で出世した人だ
He is a self-made man―He has made himself what he is.
自力で成功したのだ
He has succeeded by his own exertions―He can thank himself for his success.
自力解脱
self-emancipation
自力教
the doctrine of salvation by works

しりきれとんぼ〔尻切れ蜻蛉〕
〈名〉A dragon-fly with its tail cut off:(より)a man who leaves things half-done; anything that ends abruptly

content:
しりくせ〔尻癖〕
〈名〉Want of chastity

content.content: 尻癖の悪い女だ
She is an unchaste woman―a wanton girl―a light-skirts.

content:
しりごみ〔尻込み〕
〈名〉Recoil; recession:(=する) to recoil (from a sight); to recede (from a promise); to shrink (from some task); to back out (of a scheme); to hang back; to hold back; to shrink back

content.content: いざとなると皆尻込みした
At the last moment, all held back―hung back.
その恐ろしい光景を見て尻込みせぬ者は無い
Everybody recoils from the horrible sight.
約束をしておきながら今頃尻込みをしては困る
You must not recede from your promise at the eleventh hour.
仕事が骨が折れるので皆尻込みして手を出す者が無い
Everybody shrinks from the difficult task.
その計画がいやになって尻込みをし出す者がある
Some people begin to back out of the scheme.

content:
じりじり
〈副〉
1. Little by little; inch by inch; by inches; slowly and steadily

content.content: じりじり進む
to move slowly and steadily―make slow and steady progress
じりじり主義が勝つ
“Slow and steady wins the race.”
あの病いはじりじり死ぬ病いだ
The patient dies by inches.
(巻き狩などして)じりじりとつめ寄る
to edge in closer and closer
巡洋艦が逃げる敵にじりじりと接近した
The cruiser edged down upon the chase―edged in with the chase.
じりじりとすり寄る
to edge up to a man
日がじりじりと照りつける
The sun beats down upon your head.

しりすぼまり〔尻窄り〕
〈形〉Tapering (to a point)
しりぞいてかんがえる

しりぞいてかんがえる〔退いて考える〕
〈自動〉To pause to think; to stop and consider

しりぞいてまもる〔退いて守る〕
〈自動〉To stand on the defensive; to maintain existing conditions; to adopt a conservative policy

content:
しりぞく〔退く〕
〈自動〉
1. (=後へ引く)to retreat; to fall back; to fall behind; to retrograde; to recede (from view); to retrocede (from sight)

content.content: 敵は日本軍を恐れて退いた
The enemy retreated before the Japanese.
露軍は遼陽に敗れ退いて奉天に拠る
The Russians, defeated at Liaoyang, retreated on Mukden―fell back on Mukden.
進まざる者は退く
He who will not advance, will fall behind―retrograde.
彼は進むことを知って退くことを知らぬ
He is foolhardy.
一歩退く
to take a step backward
一歩も退かない決心だ
I am determined to hold my ground―stand my ground―contest every inch of the ground―dispute every inch of the ground.
二人は互いに一歩も退かない
They will not yield an inch to each other.
船がだんだん退いて遠くなる
The ship recedes from view―retrocedes from sight.
退いて考える
to pause to think―stop and consider
退いて守る
to stand on the defensive―maintain existing conditions―adopt a conservative policy

content: 2. (=ひきさがる、退出する)to withdraw (from one's presence); to retire (from life)

content.content: 御前を退く
to withdraw from the Imperial presence―retire from the Imperial presence
官を退く
to retire from one's office―resign one's post
世を退く
to retire from active life
政界を退く
to retire from politics
実業界を退く
to retire from business
功成り名遂げて身退くは天の道なり
To render service, to win renown, and then to retire from life, is the way of Heaven.
退いて新材に道を譲る
to make way for young talent

content:
しりぞける〔斥ける〕
〈他動〉
1. (=遠ざける、放逐する)to get rid of (one); to remove (an official); to dismiss (a servant)

content.content: 役人を斥ける
to remove an official―dismiss an official
奸臣を斥ける
to clear the Court of traitors
二人は人を斥けて密談をした
They desired the people to leave the room in order to have a private talk.

content: 2. (=拒絶する、はねつける)to refuse (a request); to reject (a proposal); to repel (an offer); to repulse (one's advances); to spurn at (a favour)

content.content: 要求を斥ける
to refuse one's demands
申込を斥ける
to reject a proposal―repel an offer―repulse an offer―spurn at an offer
意見を斥けられた
My opinion was rejected.
彼は大臣のお声がかりで来たのだから斥けることはできぬ
We can not refuse him, for he comes recommended by Minister.
婦人はその男の接近を斥けなかった
The lady encouraged his advances.

content:
しりぞける〔退ける〕
〈他動〉To beat back; to repel; to repulse

content.content: 敵を退ける
to beat back the enemy―repel the enemy―repulse the enemy
